intro: Obione torreyi, commonly known as the Torrey's obione, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid environments. It features small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
